intro: Gasteranthus tenellus, commonly known as the "Cupflower," is a striking plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, cup-shaped flowers that come in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant produces small, ornamental fruits that resemble tiny cups, which give it its common name. Gasteranthus tenellus thrives in cool, humid environments and is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its unique appearance. It is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
